featured_reviews.review_id:
Uttarkashi is situated at a distance of 154 kilometres from Rishikesh, on the Rishikesh- Gangotri route. The Viswanath Temple is the most important and ancient holy shrine in this region. Of the many temples in Uttarkashi, the temple of Lord Vishwanath is unrivalled in importance. Shiva, the presiding deity of this temple, is worshipped all day here. Every evening, visitors are greeted by the sound of bells, and the chanting of mantras by pundits at the puja.Within the courtyard of the Vishwanath temple, and to the front of it, is the Shakti Temple, dedicated to the goddess of strength. The massive brass trident projecting from this temple bears an inscription describing how the Vishwanath Temple was built. According to it, the temple was built by King Ganeshwar, whose son Guh, a great warrior, built the trident. 26 feet high, this trident's base measures 8 feet 9 inches, and its top, 18'/2 inches in circumference.
The town of Gopeshwar also features a Shiva Temple and a trident with Sanskrit inscriptions. It is much smaller.

featured_reviews.review_id:
bhaagiirthii ke kinaare uttrkaashii (baadd'aahaatt) meN vishvnaath mNdir kaa praaciin mNdir hai /  isii kaarnn yhaaN kaa naam uttr kii kaashii pdd'aa hai /  sknd puraann meN ullekh hai ki 'ydaa paapsy baahulyN yvnaakraantbhutlm  /  bhvissyti tdaa vipraa nivaasN himvdgiro  /  /  kaashyaa sh krissyaami srvtiirth: smnvit: /  andisiddhN me sthaanN vttte srvdey hi /  / '

arthaat 'jb paap kaa baahuly hogaa tthaa pRthvii yvnoN se akraant ho jaayegii, tb meraa nivaas himaaly prvt meN hogaa /  anaadisiddh himaaly srvdaa hii meraa sthaan rhaa hai /  maiN usko is smy yaanii klyug meN kaashii ke shit smst tiirthoN ko uttr kii kaashii meN yukt kr duuNgaa / '

skndpuraann ke kedaarkhNdd meN bhgvaan aashutoss ne uttrkaashii ko kliyug kii kaashii ke naam se sNbodhit kiyaa hai /  saath hii unhoNne vykt kiyaa hai ki ve apne privaar, smst tiirth sthaanoN evm kaashii shit kliyug meN us sthaan pr vaas kreNge /  jhaaN pr ek alaukik svyNbhuu liNg, jo ki dvaadsh jyotirligoN meN se ek hai, sthit hai /  arthaat, uttrkaashii meN vaas kreNge / 
uttrkaashii meN bhgvaan vishvnaath anaadi kaal se cir smaadhi meN liin hokr mNdir meN viraajmaan haiN /  bhgvaan aashutoss yhaaN sdiyoN se sNsaar ke smst praanniyoN kaa apne shubhaashiiss se klyaann krte aa rhe haiN / 

vishvnaath mNdir ko lekr maanytaa hai ki is mNdir kii sthaapnaa prshuraam dvaaraa kii gii thii /  yhaaN paassaann shivliNg 56 seNttimiittr uuNcaa evm dkssinn ki or jhukaa huaa hai /  grbhgRh meN bhgvaan gjaann evm maataa paarvtii shivliNg ke smmukh viraajmaan hai / 

vaahy gRh meN nNdii prtiikssaart haiN /  vrtmaan mNdir kaa puurnnoddhaar sn 1857 meN ttihrii gddh'vaal ki raanii khnettii devii ptnii ttkaaliin raajaa sudrshn shaah ne krvaayaa thaa /  mNdir kaa nirmaann ktyuurii shailii meN paassaann ke aadhaar pr kiyaa gyaa hai /  mNdir ke nirmaann meN ptthr kaa pryog kiyaa gyaa hai / 

prisr meN vidymaan hai 1500 vrss puraanaa trishuul

vishvnaath mNdir prisr meN kii any mNdir bhii sthiti haiN /  in meN sbse mhtvpuurnn hai shkti mNdir jo vishvnaath mNdir ke saamne sthit hai /  yhaaN devii ek vishaal trishuul ke ruup meN viraajmaan haiN /  yh trishuul 16.5 phiitt uuNcaa hai aur lgbhg 1500 vrss puraanaa hai / 

yh uttraakhNdd ke praaciintm dhaarmik cihnoN meN se ek hai /  is trishuul pr tibbtii bhaassaa ke aalekh aNkit haiN jo ki bhaart aur tibbt ke saaNskRtik aadaan-prdaan kaa dhyotk haiN /  trishuul pr naag vNsh kii vNshaavlii bhii aNkit hai / 

siNh dvaar ke donoN or vibhinn chotte mNdiroN meN bhgvaan gnnesh kii praaciin muurtiyaaN sthaapit haiN /  mNdir prisr meN saakssii gopaal aur maarkNddey Rssi ke mNdir bhii sthaapit haiN /  kiNvdntii ke anusaar Rssi maarkNddey alpaayu se shaapit the / 

vh vishvnaath mNdir meN hii tpsyaart the /  jb mRtyu ke devtaa ymraaj unke praann lene ke lie aaye to Rssi vishvnaath se jaakr liptt gye /  unkaa prem evm bhkti dekh kr bhgvaan atyNt prsnn huye aur unhoNne ymraaj ko khaalii haath vaaps bhej diyaa /  maarkNddey kii alpaayuu puurnnaayu meN privrtit ho gii /  isii kaarnn vishvnaath mNdir meN shivliNg dkssinn kii or jhukaa huaa hai /

featured_reviews.review_translated_text:
There is an ancient temple of Vishwanath temple in Uttarkashi (Badahat) on the banks of Bhagirathi. For this reason this place is named Kashi of the North. It is mentioned in Skanda Purana that 'Yada papasya bahulyaam yavanakrantabhutalam. Bhavishyati Tada Vipra Nivasam Himavadgiro. Kashya Saha Karishyami Sarvatirtha: Coordinated. Anadisiddha me sthanam vattate sarvadeya hi.'

That is, 'When there will be abundance of sins and the earth will be infested with Yavanas, then my residence will be in the Himalayan Mountains. The eternal Himalayas have always been my place. At this time i.e. in Kaliyuga, I will unite all the pilgrimage places including Kashi in Kashi of the North.

In Kedarkhand of Skandapuran, Lord Ashutosh has addressed Uttarkashi as Kashi of Kaliyuga. He has also expressed that he will reside at that place in Kaliyuga along with his family, all the pilgrimage places and Kashi. Where a supernatural Swayambhu Linga, which is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas, is situated. That is, will reside in Uttarkashi.
In Uttarkashi, Lord Vishwanath is present in the temple absorbed in eternal samadhi since time immemorial. Lord Ashutosh has been here for centuries providing welfare to all the living beings of the world with his blessings.

Regarding Vishwanath Temple, it is believed that this temple was established by Parashurama. Here the stone Shivalinga is 56 centimeters high and inclined towards the south. In the sanctum sanctorum, Lord Gajanan and Mother Parvati are seated in front of Shivling.

Nandi is waiting in the outer house. The present temple was completely renovated in 1857 by Rani Khaneti Devi of Tehri Garhwal, wife of the then King Sudarshan Shah. The temple is constructed on stone base in Katyuri style. Stone has been used in the construction of the temple.

1500 years old trident is present in the campus

There are many other temples also located in the Vishwanath temple complex. The most important among these is the Shakti Temple which is situated in front of the Vishwanath Temple. Here the Goddess is seated in the form of a huge trident. This trident is 16.5 feet high and is approximately 1500 years old.

This is one of the oldest religious symbols of Uttarakhand. There are inscriptions in Tibetan language on this trident which are indicative of the cultural exchange between India and Tibet. The genealogy of the Naga dynasty is also inscribed on the trident.

Ancient idols of Lord Ganesha are installed in various small temples on either side of the Lion Gate. Temples of Sakshi Gopal and Markandeya Rishi are also established in the temple complex. According to legend, sage Markandeya was cursed with short life.

He was doing penance in Vishwanath temple itself. When Yamraj, the god of death, came to take his life, the sage went and hugged Vishwanath. Seeing their love and devotion, God was extremely pleased and sent Yamraj back empty handed. Markandeya's short life turned into full life. For this reason, the Shivalinga in Vishwanath temple is inclined towards the south.

featured_reviews.review_id: This is a sacred ancient place related to mahamuni Markandeya and Yamraj. Lord Biswanath punished Yamraj and forced him to allow Markandeya to live up to "seventh kalpant". It's a nice peaceful place. A big ancient trishul   in Shakti mandir amazed us.
featured_reviews.review_text: This is a sacred ancient place related to mahamuni Markandeya and Yamraj. Lord Biswanath punished Yamraj and forced him to allow Markandeya to live up to "seventh kalpant". It's a nice peaceful place. A big ancient trishul   in Shakti mandir amazed us.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The Kashi Vishwanath Temple, often referred to as the Shri Kashi Vishwanath Temple, is one of the holiest and most revered Hindu temples in India. However, it's important to note that the Kashi Vishwanath Temple is located in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, not Uttarkashi, which is a different town in Uttarakhand. Nevertheless, let me provide you with some information about the Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Varanasi.

The Kashi Vishwanath Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva, one of the principal deities in Hinduism. It is situated on the western bank of the holy Ganges River in Varanasi, one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world and a significant pilgrimage site for Hindus.

The temple has a rich history that spans centuries. It is believed to have been originally constructed in the 11th century by King Harishchandra of the Kashi Naresh dynasty. However, the temple as it stands today was largely built in the 18th century by Queen Ahilyabai Holkar of Indore, following its earlier destruction by the Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb.

The Kashi Vishwanath Temple is not just an architectural marvel but also a spiritual and cultural hub. It features a stunning, gold-plated spire and intricately designed walls. The temple complex is known for its serene and spiritual atmosphere, attracting thousands of devotees and tourists daily.

One of the most cherished rituals at the temple is the Ganga Aarti, which takes place every evening on the ghats of the Ganges River. This elaborate ceremony involves the offering of prayers, incense, and lamps to the river, accompanied by devotional songs and the ringing of bells. The sight of thousands of lamps floating on the river during the aarti is a mesmerizing and spiritually uplifting experience.

Visiting the Kashi Vishwanath Temple is not just a religious pilgrimage but also an opportunity to immerse oneself in the rich cultural and spiritual heritage of India. It is a place where history, devotion, and the timeless flow of the Ganges come together, making it a symbol of India's deep-rooted spirituality and cultural diversity.

featured_reviews.review_id: Nice little temple. Peaceful. During evenings you may find a lot of rush, but the crowd is managed well and you can get darshan quickly. There is paid parking spot and the approach road is dotted with vendors.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Title: A Spiritual Oasis in the Himalayas: Vishwanath Temple, Uttarkashi

Nestled amidst the breathtaking Himalayan landscapes, Vishwanath Temple in Uttarkashi is a divine haven that beckons pilgrims and nature enthusiasts alike. Having recently visited this sacred site, I am compelled to share my awe-inspiring experience.

The journey to Vishwanath Temple is an adventure in itself. The winding roads offer panoramic views of snow-capped peaks, lush valleys, and the mighty Bhagirathi River. Upon reaching the temple, the sense of tranquility is palpable. The serene ambiance and crisp mountain air instantly make you forget the chaos of daily life.

The temple's architecture is a testament to the region's rich heritage. Its intricate wooden carvings and stone structures reflect the timeless devotion of the people. Inside, the sanctum sanctorum houses a mesmerizing Shiva Lingam, a symbol of Lord Shiva's divine presence. The rhythmic chants of priests and the fragrance of incense create an atmosphere of spiritual bliss.

One of the most memorable aspects of my visit was the evening Aarti ceremony. The lamps, bells, and melodious hymns create a mystical aura that touches the soul. Witnessing the ceremony by the Bhagirathi River adds an extra layer of enchantment.

Beyond its spiritual significance, Vishwanath Temple offers a sense of connection to nature. The surrounding forests and pristine river waters provide ample opportunities for meditation and introspection. The temple's location also serves as a base for treks to nearby Himalayan trails, making it a paradise for adventure seekers.

In conclusion, Vishwanath Temple in Uttarkashi is not just a religious destination but a holistic experience. It's a place where faith, nature, and culture converge to create an unforgettable journey. Whether you seek spiritual solace or wish to immerse yourself in the Himalayan beauty, this temple has something profound to offer. A visit here is a pilgrimage for the soul, and I can't recommend it enough.
featured_reviews.review_text:

featured_reviews.review_id: The Shakti Temple is situated right in front of the Vishwanath Temple. The temple has a huge 'trishul' which is six meters high and has a circumference of 90 cm towards the bottom. It is believed that the upper portion of the 'trishul' is made of iron, while the lower part is made of copper. According to epics, this 'trishul' was thrown by Goddess Durga or Shakti on demons One amazing feature of the trishul is that it cannot be moved with your entire body force but it vibrates the moment you apply pressure with one of your fingers. temple remains open for darshan from 5 am to 1 pm and from 4 pm to 8 pm in the evening
featured_reviews.review_text: The Shakti Temple is situated right in front of the Vishwanath Temple. The temple has a huge 'trishul' which is six meters high and has a circumference of 90 cm towards the bottom. It is believed that the upper portion of the 'trishul' is made of iron, while the lower part is made of copper. According to epics, this 'trishul' was thrown by Goddess Durga or Shakti on demons One amazing feature of the trishul is that it cannot be moved with your entire body force but it vibrates the moment you apply pressure with one of your fingers. temple remains open for darshan from 5 am to 1 pm and from 4 pm to 8 pm in the evening

Very famous temple in Uttarkashi. Neat and clean inside and outside the temple.
You can drive car here, parking available.
No crowd,easy for darshan.
Temple was full of spiritual Shakti and very beautiful.
I like this temple very much.

featured_reviews.review_translated_text: Historical place of Uttarakhand Shakti Sthal where huge Trishul is worshipped. It is located in Uttarkashi (Badahat) near the banks of Maa Ganga Bhagirathi in the precincts of Shri Vishwanath Temple. Here Shakti is worshiped in the form of Trishul. Goddess worshipers and This place is very good for a person connected with spirituality.

featured_reviews.review_id: Uttarkashi, is an old city which is situated on the banks of the river Bhagirathi, is a important place as a Chardham pilgrimage site in North India. Shakti Temple is situated next to Vishwanath temple in the central part of Uttarkashi town. Thousands of pilgrims from various parto of India as well as from abroad visit the temple every year.
featured_reviews.review_text: Uttarkashi, is an old city which is situated on the banks of the river Bhagirathi, is a important place as a Chardham pilgrimage site in North India. Shakti Temple is situated next to Vishwanath temple in the central part of Uttarkashi town. Thousands of pilgrims from various parto of India as well as from abroad visit the temple every year.

featured_reviews.review_id: Nestled in the lap of nature, this temple gives a feel of heaven, here the sound of bells awakens your inner strength.
featured_reviews.review_text: Nestled in the lap of nature, this temple gives a feel of heaven, here the sound of bells awakens your inner strength.

featured_reviews.review_id: Located at kashi vishwanath temple at uttarkashi. Beautiful temple with lots of positive vibes.
featured_reviews.review_text: Located at kashi vishwanath temple at uttarkashi. Beautiful temple with lots of positive vibes.

featured_reviews.review_id: Mother temple in Uttarkashi is very powerful. She is so powerful that the Trishul does not move if one pushes with arrogance. Whereas with devotion of one pushes through finger it starts shaking. Very vibrant. Good energy for uplifting oneself. Unlike other temples, no one will disturb you if you choose to meditate over there.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Nice location, big Dharamshala in Uttarkashi. Ganga ghat is nearby and Bus Stand also within 200 meters.

It's located in a narrow lanes having a decent market.
featured_reviews.review_text:
Nice location, big Dharamshala in Uttarkashi. Ganga ghat is nearby and Bus Stand also within 200 meters.

It's located in a narrow lanes having a decent market.

featured_reviews.review_id: Very nice dharmshala and they have almost everywhere in uttarakhand and may be other religious places and in season can be full booked via their offices in kolkata , Delhi. This is just alongside gangaji and close to bus stand. Very nice stay with them. Spacious too. Highly Recommended.

featured_reviews.review_translated_text:
It is one of the biggest Dharamshalas in Uttarkashi, rooms are not available anywhere else, but rooms are definitely available in Kali Kamli Dharamshala, it is huge.
The quality of its rooms is very good and cleanliness is taken care of very much, the rules are taken care of.

featured_reviews.review_id: Room price is 300rs for 1day. Rooms are not so much superior but yes for budget travelling
featured_reviews.review_text: Room price is 300rs for 1day. Rooms are not so much superior but yes for budget travelling

featured_reviews.review_id: A good place to stay. Renovation work is going on. It is just behind the birla dharmshala and just 200 metre from uttarkashi Bus stand.
featured_reviews.review_text: A good place to stay. Renovation work is going on. It is just behind the birla dharmshala and just 200 metre from uttarkashi Bus stand.

featured_reviews.review_id: Nice place to stay if you don't want hot water for bath. They don't have Hot Water Facility.
featured_reviews.review_text: Nice place to stay if you don't want hot water for bath. They don't have Hot Water Facility.

featured_reviews.review_id: Atmosphere is average. Tariff of INR 500 for 3 bed attached toilet and bathroom , INR 300 for double bed with common bathroom is good. Situated just 300-400 MTR from Bus stop. Be ready to clean your bed as there is no dedicated for room service.

places.name: Birla Dharamshala, Uttarkashi
places.address: PCHQ+R37 Birla Dharamshala, Uttarkashi, Uttarkashi, Uttarakhand 249193

featured_question.question: Where from  I may book the rooms at uttar kashi

featured_reviews.review_id: No room service is provided, it's all self help
featured_reviews.review_text: No room service is provided, it's all self help

featured_reviews.review_id:
As it is a dharamshala, the ambiance is different from any commercial hotels. It is a huge property in heat of Uttarkashi town just opposite the bus stand. Also mall road, Viswanath temple and other important points are just in a walkable distance.

Price is very reasonable and 4 people can be accommodated in a room comfortably. Room size is big and with separate 4 single beds.
Just outside the hotel there are a lot of options available for food.
Hotel also have a parking space.
Overall it was a pleasant stay in the Dharamshala.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Very nice place to stay at in Uttarkashi. A beautiful park inside, lots of greenery. Situated just opposite to Uttarkashi bus stand.
1.For solo travellers - Rs200 per bed per day is a good option
2. Family rooms are quite expensive from Rs1.5K onwards

featured_reviews.review_id: Best place for budget stay. Dormetory and rooms availanle. Just carry your own double bedsheet as sheets may not be fresj.
featured_reviews.review_text: Best place for budget stay. Dormetory and rooms availanle. Just carry your own double bedsheet as sheets may not be fresj.

featured_reviews.review_id: Nice rooms at a decent price. Always running hot water. Parking on premises available. The staff is also helpful. There is no view from the dharmshala as it's on NH 34, in the main city but everything is accessible within walkable distance including a petrol pump.
featured_reviews.review_text: Nice rooms at a decent price. Always running hot water. Parking on premises available. The staff is also helpful. There is no view from the dharmshala as it's on NH 34, in the main city but everything is accessible within walkable distance including a petrol pump.

featured_reviews.review_id: Was looking for accommodation in Uttarkashi and found this Dharamashala which is opposite of Bus stand. We asked for a deluxe room which was mentioned 990rs but was denied, but after again requesting it was offered at 1500rs. We were tired and thought of taking up the room at higher cost, but suddenly a woman came complaining about the ventilation in the room, so the care taker replied to open up the windows. Which change our mind to take room here, as no ventilation in rooms + mosquitos from outside will eat you up. So decided to check out other places.
featured_reviews.review_text: Was looking for accommodation in Uttarkashi and found this Dharamashala which is opposite of Bus stand. We asked for a deluxe room which was mentioned 990rs but was denied, but after again requesting it was offered at 1500rs. We were tired and thought of taking up the room at higher cost, but suddenly a woman came complaining about the ventilation in the room, so the care taker replied to open up the windows. Which change our mind to take room here, as no ventilation in rooms + mosquitos from outside will eat you up. So decided to check out other places.

featured_reviews.review_id: Easy on the way spot for a day stay. The prices are reasonable. The bed sheets and pillow cover were dirty. When asked to change they said this is all they got. This place has no restaurant and room service. Plan accordingly. Nearby eateries are kind a ok. Can't expect much from this place. However this is the cheapest but descent place for a short stay.

featured_reviews.review_id: Great location. Right next to Gangaji. Very spacious rooms. Could be cleaner. Providing kettle or some access to kitchen would have been nice. Otherwise everything else is perfect here.
featured_reviews.review_text: Great location. Right next to Gangaji. Very spacious rooms. Could be cleaner. Providing kettle or some access to kitchen would have been nice. Otherwise everything else is perfect here.

featured_reviews.review_id:
It's just like a home stay. They have sperate kitchen. And food will be cocked as desired.
I it is located at a very beautiful location. River flowing just adjacent to the place makes it like we are in the heaven. The lawn is also very relaxing. Sitting in lawn with the view of flowing River is a great experience.

featured_reviews.review_id: Brilliant place to stay and as the perfect point for many places of interest nearby. Comfy & clean rooms, river Ganga right in front, lovely garden to walk or sit lazily, enjoy the valley from your balcony. Food and tea also served/prepared on order.

Thanks
